name: Hilton New Orleans/St. Charles Avenue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Location is key in New Orleans. Unless you are still in college, Bourbon street is a walk through and not a place to spend the night. There is so much more to NO. Staying in the downtown area lets you explore the entire city. This hotel is surrounded by fantastic restaurants and outdoor music venues. The best part is really the staff, made up of the nicest and most accommodating people. That being said, the hotel is really more of a three star. Clean, but very outdated and smelled heavily of cigarette smoke. Also, there is nothing to do here, with the exception of the attached restaurant. It's a very basic, no thrills kinda place. Strangely, there is a pool in the basement, but I really didn't see the point of using an indoor pool when the weather was so beautiful outdoors.
reviews.title: Nice staff, average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here from New Year's Eve through January 3. The property is nice and our room was very modern. A little on the small side, but that is what I expected for a restored historic property that has been turned into a hotel. We paid about $20 extra per night for an upgrade to the Executive floor - here that had a pretty nice breakfast buffet each morning, and snacks and drinks in the fridge throughout the day. This property is just a short 3 blocks or so to Canal Street and the French Quarter. Was very quiet at night. Also, a nice outdoor observation deck/patio on the 18th floor. I would definitely stay here again. (No wireless internet in the rooms - just common areas.)
reviews.title: Fantastic!!! Great location and Great Value!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Just wanted to share a shocking experience with hilton...
reviews.title: Shocking Experience with Hilton in New Orlean' Charles Ave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is about my recent short stay with hotel from 16th Jan 2012 to 19th Jan 2012. We were ~ 80 delegates from one corporate house... We were having our business meeting...
reviews.title: Super location and great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: After taking bath on 17th Jan, i went to the conference room in the hotel for business meeting. When i came in evening in my room i was shocked... My shoe was missing... can u belive shoes were missing...(Well it was a marble from Reebok, was just 7 days old). Later on i found my Shaving raszer was also missing.... again can u belive raizer... Later when i checked all my lugaage, i got to know even my digital camera and some cash were also missing...
reviews.title: Avoid being swayed by the odd critisism
Not Recommended
reviews.text: Although this hotel was recently renovated and looks like a four star hotel, the service and amenities are significantly inferior. Several times during our stay, we heard the excuse " We have only been open a month." This appeared to be the standard answer to all problems. If you feel compelled to stay at this hotel, I suggest visiting only after enough time has gone by (nine months to one year) and they can no longer use this as an excuse for poor service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food on the Conceirge/Executive Level was horrible, stale and spoiled if they put any food out at all. They served prepackaged muffins that had expiration dates of May 1 , 2007 (I stayed at the hotel during 4th of July)...if staying on the Executive Level, you may have breakfast served or you may not - but don't rely on it. - not even coffee..the fitness center looks great, but only two of the cardio machines can actually be plugged in...then again, they've have "only been open a month."
reviews.title: It is the Flower of St. Charles

likes.disliked: — Water in bathroom did not get hot enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in close to midnight. As Diamond members, we politely asked for an upgrade and received a small suite. The bedroom was very small and it was difficult to open the closet door because the door was so close to the bed. The bathroom also needs updating. However, the staff was friendly and pleasant.
reviews.title: Old, but respectable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Exec Lounge was only open for breakfast during the weekend. We showed up at 7:30 on a Saturday morning and breakfast didn't begin until 8:00. However, the staff offered to bring out some pastries for us.
reviews.title: I would look else where first.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't believe that the evening wine reception is well advertised. Supposedly, between 4:00 and 6:00, the concierge desk offers red and white wine. We showed up around 5:00 for a glass of wine and then the concierge left. Do pay her a visit. She is charming and competent.
reviews.title: Great location on the St. Charles streetcar line, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Dinner next door at Luke was very good. Happy Hour drinks are half price (3:00 to 6:00).
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Arrived to the hotel at 11pm, no bellman and the valet guys was no where to be found. As for a non-smoking room and was checked into a smoking one. Ask to be moved. The focus at the front desk appearence looked less than professional.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is probably the oldest hotel I have stayed in. Really wasn't sure what to expect. Walking in you are hit with a smell of seafood from the restaurant which is onsite. The entrance is very cool tile though. I would probably rate the hotel a 3.5, I think average is too low, but very good seems a tad high. What helps me rate it very good are the people. Everyone was incredibly helpful and friendly and made us feel at home. We received an upgrade to the executive floor, which was a nice bonus. The breakfast was nothing spectacular, but definitely a nice start to the morning. I loved having a fridge stocked with water and soft drinks to grab whenever I felt the need. The location of the hotel is nice, couple minutes from canal and from the river and maybe 15 mins from the center of the french quarter. We walked over to frenchman street one night (amazing, highly recommend for any music lovers) and the walk wasn't too bad. Stopped in a few bars along the way :) Compared to some of the prices the other hotels in the area charge, I thought the Hilton provided a great value and I would definitely consider staying there again on future visits.
reviews.title: Better than Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This was a very decent hotel. The room was clean, the bathroom was modern, and there was a nice tv. The staff was very polite.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TV was limited- only basic stations and ESPN.
reviews.title: Not of Hilton standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There is a great restaurant - Luke's - downstairs. Luke's also provides the room service.
reviews.title: It's Great - What I'd expect from a Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: It is an easy walk to the shops on Canal Street, the Quarter, and to offices on St. Charles.
reviews.title: The Front Desk Can't Manage a Wake-Up Call

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in early Feb (per Mardi Gras) and AI really enjoyed the "frenchy" decor, nice service and especially the location of the hotel. We were given a 17th floor room (executive level) maybe due to my Hilton Honors card. We had free breakfast and access to various goodies and coffee anytime. A free glass of wine was offered on our way in one evening and was a complet surprise. The room was not huge but very nice and most big cities have limited space. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city.
reviews.title: Very nice stay with perks
Great Location
reviews.text: The hotel lobby had great charm. The room was comfortable. It was a great location to everything in the French Quarter and to the start of the Rock N Roll New Orleans Marathon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great location, nice rooms and great front desk staff.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - but lock your things in your suitcase!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BUT BE SURE TO LOCK YOUR THINGS IN YOUR SUITCASE WHEN YOU LEAVE YOUR ROOM. I stayed there in Feb. At first I just noticed that one item was missing from my room. I gave them the benefit of the doubt and thought perhaps housekeeping accidentally got it mixed up with the linens. I reported it, but housekeeping never bothered to get back to me, even though I'd left about 4 messages.
reviews.title: Great service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It wasn't til after I got home that I noticed a couple of other smaller things were missing from one of the inside pockets of my suitcase.... which of course makes me suspect that they were taken from my room. When I finally got a hold of housekeeping to report it, I was told they'll keep an eye on it for future but that they do not reimburse guests for missing items.
reviews.title: Fabulous service, dedicated staff and beautiful historical property

aka: Hilton New Orleans / St Charles Ave Hotel
